creditline: Gift of Peggy and Leonard Lindborg
description: small; short, wide ring foot; rounded design; four "lobes" on top; small conical knob; light blue with dark blue blossom-like design on top
medium: Slip covered stoneware with underglaze cobalt blue decor and polychrome overglaze enamels
text: These covered boxes and related small vessels reflect the interest in overglaze color that began in the late fifteenth century. The designs and shapes produced in underglazed blue and white around 1500 were also made in polychrome versions. Red and green enamels were used on their own over a clear glaze or in conjunction with underglaze blue designs. Works such as these were very popular export ware especially to Indonesia and Thailand.
title: Miniature Covered Box
